result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dacari M Brown

defendant.name: Brown, Dacari M

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dacari M Brown in court.  
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Dacari M Brown.  
Attorney Stephan Nolten  in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Room 400 Courthouse.
Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dacari M Brown in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense request a DPA Hearing. 
Defense  advised to the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Dacari M Brown in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Shull. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.
  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Dacari M Brown
Current: 7617 W Glen Brook Road, Milwaukee, WI 53223 United States  (Effective: 05-17-2022)
Prior: 7616 West Glenbrook Road, Milwaukee, WI 53233
Oral No Contact Order with Pick N Save @ 5700 W Capitol Drive in Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Dacari M Brown in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Dacari M Brown not in court.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/25/2022 @1:00pm
